extraction_metadata.indication: treatment of patients with advanced non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) with KRAS G12C mutation and disease progression, monotherapy context

DE.Indication: treatment of patients with advanced non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) with KRAS G12C mutation and disease progression, monotherapy context
DE.Outcomes: progression-free survival (blinded, independent central review), overall survival (time from randomisation to death from any cause), symptomatology, health status, health-related quality of life, side effects, EORTC QLQ-C30, EORTC QLQ-LC13, BPI-SF, FACT-G GP5, PGI-C

DK.Indication: treatment of patients with advanced non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) with KRAS G12C mutation and disease progression, monotherapy context
DK.Outcomes: overall survival (OS), progression-free survival (PFS), progression-free survival (RECIST v1.1), event-free survival, time to progression (TTP), time to next treatment (TTNT), response rates, objective response rate (ORR), disease control rate, treatment duration, time to response, duration of response (DoR), adverse events, adverse events (CTCAE v5.0), adverse events (CTCAE v4.03), treatment discontinuation due to adverse events, EORTC QLQ-C30, EQ-5D-5L

EN.Indication: treatment of patients with advanced non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) with KRAS G12C mutation and disease progression, monotherapy context
EN.Outcomes: overall survival, progression-free survival, objective response rate (RECIST 1.1), adverse events, visual analogue scale, utility decrement per cycle of treatment, treatment-related disutility for intravenous administration

FR.Indication: treatment of patients with advanced non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) with KRAS G12C mutation and disease progression, monotherapy context
FR.Outcomes: progression-free survival (independent, blinded review panel; RECIST 1.1), objective response rate (independent review committee; RECIST 1.1), overall survival (time from randomization to death from any cause), duration of response (RECIST 1.1), disease control rate (proportion with complete, partial, or stable disease for ≥5 weeks), time to response (from treatment initiation to first complete or partial response), serious adverse events, serious undesirable effects, adverse drug reactions

IT.Indication: treatment of patients with advanced non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) with KRAS G12C mutation and disease progression, monotherapy context

PO.Indication: treatment of patients with advanced non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) with KRAS G12C mutation and disease progression, monotherapy context
PO.Outcomes: progression-free survival (PFS), overall response rate (ORR), disease control rate (DCR), overall survival (OS), diarrhoea, increased alanine aminotransferase, increased asparaginase aminotransferase activity, increased AST, increased ALT, fatigue, fever, peripheral oedema, shortness of breath, cough, vomiting, decreased appetite, constipation, anaemia, alopecia, neutropenia, headache, chest pain, abdominal pain, joint pain, back pain, nausea, adverse events (general), treatment-related adverse events, treatment-related adverse reactions (grade ≥3), treatment-associated adverse experiences leading to discontinuation, dose modification-related adverse drug reactions, treatment-associated adverse events resulting in death, EORTC QLQ-C30, EORTC QLQ-LC13, quality of life, quality-adjusted life years (QALYs), cost-effectiveness (incremental cost-effectiveness ratio, ICER), budget impact analysis

PT.Indication: treatment of patients with advanced non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) with KRAS G12C mutation and disease progression, monotherapy context
PT.Outcomes: objective response rate (ORR), duration of response (DoR), disease control rate, time to progression, time to next treatment, overall survival (OS), progression-free survival (PFS; RECIST v1.1), event-free survival, duration of treatment, dropout rate, mortality-related toxicity, adverse events (CTCAE v5.0), serious adverse events (grade 3-4), quality of life, overall health status, physical functioning

SE.Indication: treatment of patients with advanced non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) with KRAS G12C mutation and disease progression, monotherapy context
SE.Outcomes: progression-free survival (PFS), overall survival (OS), quality-adjusted life years (QALYs), cost-effectiveness (cost per QALY), health-related quality of life (measured by time to death)
